caption: Placed an order through delivery.com on 2/26/21. A hour passed from the time I ordered which I found strange because I live nearby and they usually come in a timely manner. I called the restaurant to find out the eta. Unfortunately a very rude woman answered the phone yelling that the order was cancelled because we didn’t answer the phone. When I asked what # they called she read back the wrong#. I asked why did the delivery person did not ring the bell. She had no answer and basically told me do I want the food or refund. I told her I would like a refund since it’s been a 1 1/2.  Instead of her processing the refund she told me to call delivery.com. When I called she gave the representative from delivery.com an attitude and a hard time. Delivery.com advised me that they would have to get a supervisor involved and call me back, however I eventually received my refund. I’ve ordered from Beverly for years and I have never experienced this level of customer service. This will be my last time ever ordering from them. Management needs to reprimand this employee as she needs retraining. Especially in the times we are living in you would think businesses are appreciative of the business you are giving them. There is plenty of other pizzerias in the area & there food is actually better and customer service is their #1 priority. Good luck Beverly you officially lost a loyal customer!!!!
I've been having pizza from them since 2017 and they never miss to make it the best one❤️
Pleasant and quick service. Good food.
Delicious pizza! High quality Brooklyn pizza. The real deal.
Best place making good pasta and Best pizza Then make. 5 Star

I ordered a chicken roll and they didn’t even give me no sauce for it It taste like straight oil and bread chicken has no flavor and both slices I also ordered was terrible gave the dude a tip but he forgot my 2 liter soda... he went back to get it for me and asked for another tip lol like what...

One of the most unprofessional and greedy locations I've ever been to. They charge you money for a cup of marinara sauce which is commonly included for free at almost any other pizza establishment with your order of garlic knots or mozzarella sticks. The garlic knots themselves cost too much for what they're worth. The pizza pie I bought also had an extremely lacking layer of tomato sauce, to the point where I thought it was completely missing at first. Avoid like the plague, if you respect yourself and your money.
Consistently delicious and have specialty pizzas others don't. I recommend the bacon vodka pizza or the creamy artichoke pizza ;)
Very good
This place has really great, authentic Italian food if you are craving it. The Eggplant Parmigiana is amazing!!
I was in the area stopped to try slice not bad sauce little sweet out pizza was good I recommend trying if your in the area I would deff go back
I always order pizza from here, one of my favorites in Brooklyn. Great NY style pizza and they deliver fast.

Nice, friendly, neighborhood pizza place. Does a good job of adhering to social distance guidelines. Staff is always nice and family lives in the neighborhood. Good people. Most of their food is pretty good.
Reasonable prices and the food is always great!
Good service, nicer than the other place on church Ave. Pizza is very good. Some of the people taking phone orders can learn some manners.
Margarita pizza was on point. Better pizza and better price than Korner pizza
Great place to eat. I like cheesecakes pepprs and onion hummmmmmm

Worse customer service. I ordered vegetable   Pizza and when I receive my order it was just the regular pizza. After I called them and talk about it, she just hanged up on my face. What kind of behavior is this.
Sausage Pizza is excellent. I have not tried anything else.
Pretty good for it's price. Got the job done. Currently 15$ for a cheese pie. Will return definitely.
I order from here consistently and the pizza is always delicious & the deliver is quick. I can not recommend this place enough
Because they are a rip-off the price is too high $5 for two sausages is way too much remember to ask how much something cost before you buy it
Awesome local pizza in Brooklyn.
Jesus, the worst meatball sandwich I ever tried. Just mush with gigantic frozen meatballs inside, yak. Threw out half of the sandwich,  please be aware! Do not order meatball sandwich!

Their pizza is decent but I warn you...DO NOT GET THEIR CALAMARI! 🤢🤮I’ve never had bad calamari from any pizzeria before but this place turned me off from it for the rest of my life. Huge jumbo ringlets that weren’t even crispy or brown. Just undercooked with the coating falling off. The texture of it while chewing felt extremely disgusting because they were so massive. When I called Grubhub to ask for another order they declined and said I “should’ve requested for my order to be crispy and bite sized”.  Oh really? So customers need to request for their order to be of standard now? Wish I could give this place 0 stars.
Great pizza, moved in the area and that's now our pizza delivery spot
Great Pizza!!!
The staff is nice .food is good.

Just ordered from here and I couldn't be more disappointed. 🤢 I ordered a Texas burger with fries. The burger wasn't the worst that's why I gave 2 stars but the bun was a soggy mess and almost falling apart, not to mention the fries were more stale than cardboard. 👎👎👎 The delivery was fast, I'll give them that but the overall food quality was pretty bad.
Really darn good pizza - crispy with a lot of toppings and clean places to sit too. Def pizza joint in the neighborhood for sure.
Good food
Like this place for delicious cheese pie and very quick delivery. Definitely coming back

Favorite neighborhood pizza place for thin crust New York-style pizza; lots of cheese, easy on the tomato sauce, not too greasy, but enough that the oil dribbles over the slice when you fold it. My only gripe is that I wish they would bake the crust for the small pies as crispy as they do for the large.
Great classic New York style pizza.
Edible.  That's about it.  Marinara tastes like a plastic bag.  Crust is good thiugh.
I love their pizza & hot wings . The wings are always good & crispy .
Great place!
Great spot for great pizza
Great local pizza very authentic
Definitely my favorite pizza in Brooklyn!
Had the baked ziti. Obviously this dish isn't made for take out per say, as your mom will work for hours on the perfect ziti, but this wasn't bad. Will come back to try more
Great Buffalo chicken!!
Excellent
i love this pizza and the meat ball sub was great customer service was the best a clean place the bath room was clean and the food was great i just love it this is my go to place
wow great pizza i love it the one of the best in new york i dont really rate on google that much but wow  i just had to they came  fast and the pizza was great  love it and i will always come here

ON OF THE BEST PIZZA I HAVE TASTED IT WAS GREAT  THEY GOT IT DONE  GREAT PERFECT THEY EVEN HAVE A TV  WOW PERFECT THE BATH ROOM IS VERY CLEAN MOST PIZZA PLACES ARE NOT CLEAN BUT THIS PLACE OUTSTANDING
An OK neighborhood pizza place. Not too bad, not too good, just someplace to call when you need a pie and aren't too fussy about whether its perfect.
Pizza has alot of cheese but very little sauce
Good but not for 14$ a pie
Good food and service. Their Eggplant parm and garlic knots are my favorite!
Good food not bad
Delicious pizza. One hot beautiful girl at the counter.
The pizza dough is so fluffy and buttery, and the sauce is perfect. I would say that it's the best pizzeria in the area.  Edit: I recommend getting a buffalo chicken pizza slice or a chicken roll.

When you order a pie for almost $20 that has "creamy artichoke" in the name, you expect some artichoke in it. I just got my order. Looks like it was the last leaf of artichoke head they had. Shame on you. Update. You are asking for another chance. Sure , but not at my expense.

(Translated by Google) Very nice, they serve you in Spanish, and the pizza does not even talk delicious, greetings  (Original) Muy bonito, te atienden en español, y las pizza ni hablar riquísima, saludos
Superb margarita They've the finest crust in the neighbourhood.
The pizza is excellent
Absolutely one of the top best pizza shops in Brooklyn.  The prices are fair.  The owners and employees are hard working towards customer satisfaction.
Good pizza!
Solid pizza

I ordered a pie and a 2 liter bottle of soda for delivery. They came and brought the pie but no bottle of soda only 1 can of soda. Called the place and they said they assumed it was a can and they would send a bottle straight over. Group of friends eating pizza with a can to split between us. No bottle ever showed up and they called the say they wont deliver and will only give a refund of the bottle. Everyone is left thirsty and waited for a delivery that never came
Nice place. Pizza was very hot
Perfect. The cheese is great and the crust is beautiful. They serve pretty quick too and the price is alright.
Order here all the time. Grandma's pie is amazing!
Love the pizza here
This pizza taste like .99 cent pizza that them Mexicans make. Sauce has NO FLAVOR. Next time I’ll spend the extra .50 around the block !
Pizza is ok, grandma is the way to go. Prompt delivery.
Best Pizza in the neighborhood, indoor and outdoor seating. Wifi, big flat screen tv and most importantly friendly people.
It tastes AMAZING. It's like Flavors Bursting to your mouth. But it is a little Hot.
Best pizza in the neighborhood.
Great pizza good atmosphere these spot is like a hidden gem in church ave if you come by the store u need to try the penne alla vodka thats my favorite
This place sells the best pizza in town.
The.pizza is good, , the prices are great & the owners & people working there are super nice & friendly .  And they are real Italians.
Buffalo chicken wings OMG they are crispy and good
Good solid local pizza!

I order from this place thinking I was going to get good customer service, guy was rude and threw the money at me , worst experience ever sticking to my neighborhood friendly pizzerias in BENSONHURST!
Nice and fast service. The food is good, the garlic knots is a must try. good price, whole pie for $13. not much sitting space.
Very nice place with great service

This pizza is the best Pizza I have ever had, I eat here all the time, The pizza is amazing so are the pasta dishes and appetizers. The staff is very friendly and they follow special instructions, I wouldn't go anywhere else but here for my Italian food.
This was one of the best pizza I have had.  Its the best local pizzeria around.  I have been going here since they opened and the pizza and staff and prices are good.  Thanks for the good pizza.
Seamless delivery took 2.5 hours. Pizza crust was hard and flavorless. Calzone was inedible. Garlic knots were stale. Salad wrap was ok. Cheesecake was decent. Definitely will not return.
Best pizza in neighborhood
Delivery man was so rude when I picked up the pizza but pizza was great.

I wish I could give it 0 stars. My mother ordered a chicken parm with our order. We didn't receive it and they said that no one wrote it down. We asked them to make one and send it. They said that they wouldn't send it because it was less then the minimum order. NOT MY PROBLEM.
In my opinion better then corner pizza, i order here all the time and never had a problem with the food or customer service.

Pizza was pretty good as was meatball sub. Delivery was super slow but food was hot. Caesar salad was wilted and came with dressing already on it, so be sure to ask for dressing on the side if that is your thing. I threw most of the salad away and since dressing was already on it could not save salad for the next day.
Cheap pizza, good pizza, not the best but the main thing is that a pizza slice here is only $2.

Don't expect good pizza or service. If you ask for anything they get upset and give you a dirty look. one of the employee almost got into argument with me because i asked for extra napkins for my little nephew and said only one napkin per customer.
Solid pizza. Nice crispy crust, yummy grandma slice!!
So so , pizza is hard and nor tasty

Today was my last time ordering pizza  from this place. They change price on the fly - say on the phone one price and when I  come to pick it up they charge me another. Not giving me a receipt and react weird when I ask for it. It's ridiculous. Thank you Beverly pizza, you just lost a customer. I used to recommend this place to my friends but I regret now

Honestly this place has to be kidding me first of all the prices don't even match the food and not in a good way it's extremely over priced I ordered a pizza burger for 4.50 and got a Little patty slapped on some buns with marinara sauce McDonalds gives you more for $1 the pizza I don't even want to talk about the pizza all I'm going to say is they're not even trying I don't know how they still opening I really don't all I know is never again will I go back
Pretty good pizza better than Korner Pizza in my opinion reasonable prices.

Don't expect anything actually tasting good. It was delivered within the expected time frame but it was really not good food. None of it was moldy or cold, but the marinara sauce was bland, it was like the cook didn't actually care whether this tastes good or not. The cheesecake was a very soft and gooey disappointment and I think it's kind of hard to mess up cheesecake this much. And the cheeseburger had nothing on it besides cheese and the meat. It was a really boring meal and nothing about it was actually good. Even the bread was hard. I really wish I would have gone to the grocery store to buy a plantain, some cream cheese and some refried beans. That's a cheaper healthier and quicker way to have dinner and it's actually delicious.
worse pizza ever never ordering there again
Left me speechless, gorgeous food. Pasta sauce a little watery. Overall great food, I recommend it.
The best

For delivery in Kensington at a reasonable price, Beverly is my go-to restaurant. Delicious plain pies, margarita and square pies. They also have great pasta dishes (baked ziti, yum!) but pass on the buffalo wings if you like typical, crispy buffalo wings with a lot of kick. Very friendly service!
